function: Loads all of the element default styles, beginning with the html and body elements, followed by elements grouped by type.
Loads all of the site's @font-face declarations.  These are loaded first.
A CSS reset, such as normalize.css, to normalize cross-browser rendering.
Returns a percentage width for columns in a layout given a number of columns the layout should be divided into.

param.name: $cols
param.description: The number of columns the layout should be divided into.  [integer]

function: Converts a target value in pixels to its associated value in ems based on a context.

param.name: $target
param.description: The target size in either pixels or its integer equivalent.  [px|integer]

param.name: $context
param.description: The context size in either pixels or its integer equivalent.  Default value: $baseFontSize.  [px|integer]

return.description: The target's value in ems within the given context.  [em]

function: Returns a unitless integer equivalent a measurement.

param.name: $n
param.description: A measurement of any kind.  [px|em|percentage]

function: Converts a target value in pixels to its associated value in rems based on the $baseFontSize.

param.name: $target
param.description: The target size in either pixels or its integer equivalent.  [px|integer]

return.description: The target's value in rems based on the $baseFontSize.  [rem]

function: The natural language grid system (using class names like "columns" and "row").  This is enabled or disabled with the $enableGrid variable.
A shortcut to creating fluid layouts with different numbers of columns at different breakpoints.

param.name: $selector
param.description: The selector to which the styles for each column will be applied.

param.name: $smallColumns
param.description: The number of columns to be displayed on small resolutions.  [integer]

param.name: $mediumColumns
param.description: The number of columns to be displayed on medium resolutions.  [integer]

param.name: $largeColumns
param.description: The number of columns to be displayed on large resolutions.  [integer]

param.name: $flush
param.description: Whether or not the columns should be flush on the outside edge of their container.  Default value: false.

param.name: $padding
param.description: A padding override to be set on all columns in the multi-grid.  Default value: $gutterInPx.

param.name: $smallBreak
param.description: The breakpoint at which to apply the number of columns defined by $smallColumns.  Default value: breakpointSmall.

param.name: $mediumBreak
param.description: The breakpoint at which to apply the number of columns defined by $mediumColumns.  Default value: breakpointMedium.

param.name: $largeBreak
param.description: The breakpoint at which to apply the number of columns defined by $largeColumns.  Default value: breakpointLarge.

function: The location to define major column layouts for your main content area.
The location to define major column layouts and styles for the footer.
The location to define major column layouts and styles for the header.

mixin: Creates the necessary dimensions for an element to have a fixed aspect ratio.

param.name: $width
param.description: The desired width of the element's aspect ratio.  Default value: 16.  [px|integer]

param.name: $height
param.description: The desired height of the element's aspect ratio.  Default value: 9.  [px|integer]

mixin: Alters the box-sizing property with the provided value.

param.name: $box-sizing
param.description: The value of the box-sizing property you wish to set.  Default value: border-box.

mixin: Outputs the desired font-size in rems with a px fallback.

param.name: $size
param.description: The desired font-size in pixels or its integer equivalent.  Default value: $baseFontSize.  [px|integer]

mixin: Adds a media query at the pre-defined breakpoint for the given content.

param.name: $media
param.description: The name of the breakpoint for which the styles are to be applied.

mixin: Outputs an rgba background-color with an opaque fallback. If a PNG is supplied, it will be used as a fallback for older IEs, and opaque background will be overridden.  Note: modernizr is required for the PNG fallback.

param.name: $color
param.description: The desired color.

param.name: $alpha
param.description: The desired level of opacity. [Decimal]

param.name: $image
param.description: Filename and extension of a variable transparency fallback. Default value: false.

mixin: Outputs an SVG image for the given property with a PNG fallback.  Notee:  modernizr is required for the PNG fallback.

param.name: $imageName
param.description: The filename, without an extension, of the image file.

param.name: $property
param.description: The CSS property to which you wish to apply the image.  Default value: background-image.

mixin: Adds a CSS transition with the given property, time, easing, and delay parameters.

param.name: $property
param.description: The CSS property to which you wish to apply the transition.  Default value: all.

param.name: $time
param.description: The amount of time for the transition to take.  Default value: 0.3s.  [seconds]

param.name: $easing
param.description: The easing function to use with the transition.  Default value: linear.

param.name: $delay
param.description: The amount of time to delay the transition.  Default value: 0s.  [seconds]

function: Renders a badge that can be used as a label, notification count, or tag.
Class used for rendering a button-shaped element.  Can be used on any element, but is most appropriate with anchors, buttons, and spans.
Class used for calling out a specific portion of the page.
A responsive modal system that can display content via AJAX, within iframes, or as inline.
Custom-styled form elements, including selects, checkboxes, and radio buttons.
Styles related to the site's navigation.
A tab system that works on all resolutions.  On lower resolutions, the tabs turn into an accordion.
A tooltip system based on Tipsy.
The place for utility classes specifically used for responsive purposes.
The place for general utility classes.
Responsive video for maintaining aspect ratio on all resolutions.

param.name: $breakpointExtraSmall
param.description: The breakpoint for the smallest resolutions.  [px]

param.name: $breakpointSmall
param.description: The breakpoint for small resolutions.  [px]

param.name: $breakpointMedium
param.description: The breakpoint for medium resolutions.  [px]

param.name: $documentWidth
param.description: The maximum width of documents.  This defaults to the value of $rowMaxWidth.  [px]

param.name: $maxDeviceWidth
param.description: The maximum width device width supported.  [px]

function: The color palette for the project.

param.name: $colorPrimary
param.description: The color palette's primary color.

param.name: $colorSecondary
param.description: The color palette's secondary color.

param.name: $colorTertiary
param.description: The color palette's tertiary color.

param.name: $lightGrey
param.description: A light grey intended for use as a shaded background color.

param.name: $mediumGrey
param.description: A medium grey intended for use as a border or accent color in conjunction with $lightGrey.

param.name: $darkGrey
param.description: A dark grey intended for us as a text or border color in conjunction with $lightGrey or $mediumGrey.

function: Quick access to specific folders in the project.

param.name: $resourcesFolder
param.description: Path to the parent resources folder

param.name: $imagesFolder
param.description: Path to the images folder, relative to the $resourcesFolder

param.name: $svgFolder
param.description: Path to the svg folder, relative to the $imagesFolder

param.name: $fontsFolder
param.description: Path to the folder containing font files (e.g. .ttf, eot), relative to the $resourcesFolder

function: The properties of the grid system to be used.

param.name: $gutterInPx
param.description: The default gutter size in pixels.  [px]

param.name: $secondaryGutterInPx
param.description: A secondary gutter size in pixels.  [px]

param.name: $rowMaxWidth
param.description: The maximum width of a row on the page.  This should be a multiple of the below variable $cols.  [px]

param.name: $cols
param.description: The number of columns in the grid system.  [integer]

param.name: $hybridCols
param.description: The number of columns in the hybrid grid system.  [integer]

param.name: $defaultFloat
param.description: The default direction in which to float content.

param.name: $switchFloat
param.description: The opposite float of $defaultFloat.

function: Various measurements used throughout the project.

param.name: $formElementBorderRadius
param.description: The default border radius for all form elements.  [px|percentage]

param.name: $widgetBorderRadius
param.description: The default border radius for all widgets.   [px|percentage]

function: Options for enabling or disabling features, including the grid system, push, and pull.

param.name: $enableGrid
param.description: Enable or disable the grid system.  If this is false, the hybrid grid will automatically be disabled.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid.

param.name: $enableHybridGrid
param.description: Enable or disable the hybrid grid system.  If enableGrid is false, this will automatically be disabled.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid.

param.name: $enabledColumns
param.description: Comma separated value list of column widths you want to support in the standard grid system; set to ( ) to include all possible columns.  If enableGrid/enableHybridGrid are set to false, this is a moot option since no column classes will be output.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid, it only minimizes the output of classes for the grid system.  [list]

param.name: $enableCentered
param.description: Enable or disable centering of columns.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid.

param.name: $enablePush
param.description: Enable or disable pushing of columns.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid.

param.name: $enablePull
param.description: Enable or disable pulling of columns.  NOTE: this does not affect the semantic grid.

function: The base typography settings for the project.

param.name: $baseFontPercentage
param.description: The percentage of the font-size to be used on the root html element.  [percentage]

param.name: $baseFontSize
param.description: The base font-size for the root html element, calculated as an integer based on $baseFontPercentage.  [integer]

param.name: $lineHeight
param.description: The base line height for the root html element.  [decimal]

param.name: $baseFontFamily
param.description: The base font-family for the root html element.
